alert.note: Alert for Arkansas; Calhoun; Cleveland; Dallas; Drew; Grant; Jefferson; Lincoln; Lonoke; Monroe; Ouachita; Prairie (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 1:48PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Cleveland, southeastern Prairie, southeastern Lonoke, southeastern Grant, northeastern Calhoun, eastern Dallas, northeastern Ouachita, western Monroe, northwestern Drew, Jefferson, Lincoln and northwestern Arkansas Counties through 215 PM CDT... At 148 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles west of Humphrey to near Kedron to near Harlow. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pine Bluff... Stuttgart... Fordyce... Star City... Rison... White Hall... England... Altheimer... Bearden... Humphrey... Grady... Kingsland... Thornton... Humnoke... Ulm... Whitefield... Little Bayou Meto Park... Hensley Island... Herbine... Nebo... This includes Interstate 530 between mile markers 24 and 46. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for central, southeastern and southwestern Arkansas. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for eastern and southeastern Arkansas.

area.areaDesc: Arkansas; Calhoun; Cleveland; Dallas; Drew; Grant; Jefferson; Lincoln; Lonoke; Monroe; Ouachita; Prairie
